quotes.t: For the most part, the descriptions of the books listed in the "Catalog," though informative, are relentlessly {qword}prosaic{/qword}, even hackneyed.
In addition to the {qword}prosaic{/qword} essentials of life—wheat, rice, and salt—the Portuguese found exotic stores of pepper, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and other spices.

… where did he get his money? He had to eat and drink, buy apparatus and chemicals, even pay the poor rate. Where did he get the common coin to meet such unavoidable if {qword}prosaic{/qword} obligations?
There is, of course, an ordinary medicine, an everyday medicine, humdrum, {qword}prosaic{/qword}, a medicine for stubbed toes, quinsies, bunions, and boils …

shortdef: characteristic of prose as distinguished from poetry : factual
